arch:note.arch:string: The purpose of the daily journal was to record the activities taking place in a trench each day. This included which loci were excavated, how and why loci were excavated and the ongoing impressions of the relationships among loci. It should be noted that journals record the actions, impressions and ideas of trench supervisors during the excavations. They are not, therefore, the final interpretations or syntheses of the emerging data.

arch:internalDocument.arch:string:
July 28, 2001

We began by sweeping then we will probably spray around L4030. Because here is a mud-brick on the section of the baulk. So we are suspecting that the wall might be continuing more in the W side.

Also when I look at the SW side I see that in the corner where we found a lot of pottery there are some pebbles started to come out. But not very visible yet.

We started to take off he surface L4026, we started from the bigger rocks on the E side.

We sprayed the wall L4030 on the W side and we saw a triangular possible plastered part there. (this wall has two different angles, the angle on the S side doesn't fit with the angle on the N side but this new thing (triangular) may fit with the angle on the N side) But it is really hard to see any other ones so we started to try from the N side instead of S side where we cut (dug as L4014) almost 25-30cm (we were looking for the other part (E-W direction of the wall (looking same as L4030)) So if we can find out that part it will be better also. In the morning when we sprayed I could easily see the wall corner with L4030 and the new one (other wall).

I will take another photo of the L4026 after we took the bigger rocks. Then we started to take the smaller stones off and there were tons of pottery there but until I saw it workers collected most of it. I made them clean and I will take another photograph although I don't know how much I could save. I gave them a new pottery bag KT4229. Now I am taking that level too. Also there is some reddish soil exists. This locus started to seem that they dumped their broken pottery there. Because from that small locus we found 3 bags of pot sherds (big bags) there was a sand stone and kind of a mud-brick there.

We took L4025 off.

There were some rocks (a small feature) on the N and we same some circular mud brick on the E side. That is also possible that there is a huge circular mud brick circle. But I don't think so.

Also next to the circle L4006 we found out another rock circle (possible) look like what we have found in C1 at the Western side of that trench.

I opened some new loci today:

L4036 is the pebble surface at the SW corner of the trench where we found a lot of pottery.

L4037 is the rock feature came under L4022 and L4021 yesterday.

L4038 is the rock feature at the NW side of the trench. The feature is a small rock grouping with kind of a circular mud brick structure on the East, looks like a screen.

L4039 is the rock feature coming up in the NE part of the trench coming under the new harder part that looks like L4030, maybe a surface.

L4040 is the hard part next to the pit L4032 looks like mudbrick. But from the section we know that we are coming to a surface so it will also be the layer on the top of a surface.

I didn't open loci for the feature next to L4006 because I want to articulate the rocks a little more.

I am quite sure that there is a difference at the soil that looks like L4030 so I will change that locus than we will find out if it is a wall or not (L4041).

We are now taking L4040 out to find out the surface. L4042 is the harder stuff on the N side of the pit L4032. (Very hard, compact) Also we dug some part of this locus because from the section that we cut, because of the ash pit, we could see that there is a surface there.

L4043 is the part of the N of the new hard packed which might be a wall. I changed the locus here because we could at last identify that there is a real difference. Also L4044 is the S side f L4041 so should be separated too.

L4045 is the layer underneath (fill) L4021. I changed the locus because we found some surface and some oven and some more stuff that I couldn't identify yet. So I may be at a level that things will change.

Summary of the day: We sprayed and searched for the borders of L4030 for long time because of some angles and some clues that we thought we couldn't find the real borders.

Then we started to approach here from L4014 (from the N) that we identify some hard stuff and found some more rocks (L4039).

We took of L4026 and there were too many pottery (4 big bags) which was suspicious. (may be a pottery pile).

L4025 we took that off too.
